ctx: intros H_1 H_2 a x Ha Hx Ha' Heq.
exceptions.exn: Unable to find an instance for the variables a, b.

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
S: Set
A: S -> Prop
Mult: S -> S -> S
Add: S -> S -> S
I: S
O: S
Opp: S -> S
v: S -> nat

Goal:
is_unitary_commutative_ring -> integrity -> forall a x : S, A a -> A x -> a <> O -> Mult a x = a -> x = I

Premises:
integrity = forall a b : S, Mult a b = O -> {a = O} + {b = O} : Set
is_unitary_commutative_ring = is_ring /\ commutativity S Mult /\ neutral S A Mult I : Prop
opp_unicity : forall (S : Set) (G : S -> Prop) (Add : S -> S -> S) (O : S) (Opp : S -> S), is_group S G Add O Opp -> forall x y : S, is_opposite S G Add O x y -> y = Opp x
opp_opp : forall (S : Set) (G : S -> Prop) (Add : S -> S -> S) (O : S) (Opp : S -> S), is_group S G Add O Opp -> forall x : S, G x -> x = Opp (Opp x)
regular_l : forall (S : Set) (G : S -> Prop) (Add : S -> S -> S) (O : S) (Opp : S -> S), is_group S G Add O Opp -> forall y z : S, G y -> G z -> forall x : S, G x -> Add x y = Add x z -> y = z
divide = fun a b : S => A a /\ A b /\ (b = O \/ a <> O /\ (exists q : S, A q /\ b = Mult a q)) : S -> S -> Prop
is_opposite : forall S : Set, (S -> Prop) -> (S -> S -> S) -> S -> S -> S -> Prop
mult_O : is_ring -> forall x : S, A x -> Mult x O = O /\ Mult O x = O
distributivity : forall S : Set, (S -> S -> S) -> (S -> S -> S) -> Prop
neutral : forall S : Set, (S -> Prop) -> (S -> S -> S) -> S -> Prop
opposite : forall S : Set, (S -> Prop) -> (S -> S -> S) -> S -> (S -> S) -> Prop
is_group : forall S : Set, (S -> Prop) -> (S -> S -> S) -> S -> (S -> S) -> Prop
commutativity : forall S : Set, (S -> S -> S) -> Prop
associativity : forall S : Set, (S -> S -> S) -> Prop
intern : forall S : Set, (S -> Prop) -> (S -> S -> S) -> Prop
mult_opp_opp : is_ring -> forall x y : S, A x -> A y -> Mult (Opp x) (Opp y) = Mult x y
mult_opp_r : is_ring -> forall x y : S, A x -> A y -> Mult x (Opp y) = Opp (Mult x y)
mult_opp_l : is_ring -> forall x y : S, A x -> A y -> Mult (Opp x) y = Opp (Mult x y)
is_ring = commutativity S Add /\ is_group S A Add O Opp /\ intern S A Mult /\ associativity S Mult /\ distributivity S Add Mult : Prop
List.count_occ : forall A : Type, (forall x y : A, {x = y} + {x <> y}) -> list A -> A -> nat
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat Arguments Datatypes.S _%nat_scope
div_mult : is_ring -> forall a b d : S, divide d a -> A b -> divide d (Mult a b)
Znat.inj_eq : forall x y : nat, x = y -> BinInt.Z.of_nat x = BinInt.Z.of_nat y
PeanoNat.Nat.lt_ind : forall A : nat -> Prop, Morphisms.Proper (Morphisms.respectful eq iff) A -> forall n : nat, A (Datatypes.S n) -> (forall m : nat, n < m -> A m -> A (Datatypes.S m)) -> forall m : nat, n < m -> A m
Relation_Definitions.relation = fun A : Type => A -> A -> Prop : Type -> Type Arguments Relation_Definitions.relation _%type_scope
BinInt.Z.lt = fun x y : BinNums.Z => BinInt.Z.compare x y = Lt : BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z -> Prop Arguments BinInt.Z.lt (_ _)%Z_scope
BinInt.Z.le = fun x y : BinNums.Z => BinInt.Z.compare x y <> Gt : BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z -> Prop Arguments BinInt.Z.le (_ _)%Z_scope
PeanoNat.Nat.case_analysis : forall A : nat -> Prop, Morphisms.Proper (Morphisms.respectful eq iff) A -> A 0 -> (forall n : nat, A (Datatypes.S n)) -> forall n : nat, A n
PeanoNat.Nat.div_mod : forall x y : nat, y <> 0 -> x = y * PeanoNat.Nat.div x y + PeanoNat.Nat.modulo x y
List.map : forall A B : Type, (A -> B) -> list A -> list B
PeanoNat.Nat.divide = fun x y : nat => exists z : nat, y = z * x : nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments PeanoNat.Nat.divide (_ _)%nat_scope
PeanoNat.Nat.pow_eq_0 : forall a b : nat, b <> 0 -> PeanoNat.Nat.pow a b = 0 -> a = 0
PeanoNat.Nat.pow_inj_l : forall a b c : nat, c <> 0 -> PeanoNat.Nat.pow a c = PeanoNat.Nat.pow b c -> a = b
PeanoNat.Nat.div_unique_exact : forall a b q : nat, b <> 0 -> a = b * q -> q = PeanoNat.Nat.div a b
PeanoNat.Nat.gcd_div_factor : forall a b c : nat, c <> 0 -> PeanoNat.Nat.divide c a -> PeanoNat.Nat.divide c b -> PeanoNat.Nat.gcd (PeanoNat.Nat.div a c) (PeanoNat.Nat.div b c) = PeanoNat.Nat.div (PeanoNat.Nat.gcd a b) c
fst = fun (A B : Type) (p : A * B) => let (x, _) := p in x : forall A B : Type, A * B -> A Arguments fst {A B}%type_scope
PeanoNat.Nat.gcd_div_gcd : forall a b g : nat, g <> 0 -> g = PeanoNat.Nat.gcd a b -> PeanoNat.Nat.gcd (PeanoNat.Nat.div a g) (PeanoNat.Nat.div b g) = 1
BinPosDef.Pos.sub = fun x y : BinNums.positive => match BinPosDef.Pos.sub_mask x y with | BinPosDef.Pos.IsPos z => z | _ => BinNums.xH end : BinNums.positive -> BinNums.positive -> BinNums.positive Arguments BinPosDef.Pos.sub (_ _)%positive_scope
PeanoNat.Nat.div_unique : forall a b q r : nat, r < b -> a = b * q + r -> q = PeanoNat.Nat.div a b
BinPosDef.Pos.to_nat = fun x : BinNums.positive => BinPosDef.Pos.iter_op Nat.add x 1 : BinNums.positive -> nat Arguments BinPosDef.Pos.to_nat _%positive_scope : simpl never
Inductive list (A : Type) : Type := nil : list A | cons : A -> list A -> list A Arguments list _%type_scope Arguments nil {A}%type_scope Arguments cons {A}%type_scope a l%list_scope : rename
PeanoNat.Nat.div_div : forall a b c : nat, b <> 0 -> c <> 0 -> PeanoNat.Nat.div (PeanoNat.Nat.div a b) c = PeanoNat.Nat.div a (b * c)

```coq
intros H_1 H_2 a x Ha Hx Ha' Heq.
unfold is_unitary_commutative_ring, integrity, divide in *.
destruct H_1 as [H_ring [H_comm H_neutral]].
destruct H_2 as [H_integrity].
apply H_integrity in Heq as H_cases.
destruct H_cases as [Ho | Ha_eq_O].
- contradiction.
- destruct Ha' as [q [Haq Hmult_eq]].
  assert (Mult a (Opp q) = O) as Hmult_opq.
  + rewrite Hmult_eq. rewrite mult_opp_r with (x:=q) (y:=a); auto.
  + apply H_integrity in Hmult_opq as [Ho' | Haq_op].
    * rewrite mult_O in Ho'; auto.
    * rewrite mult_opp_l in Haq_op; auto.
      rewrite Ho' in Haq_op. contradiction.
Qed. Qed.```

original: intros H_1 H_2 a x Ha Hx Ha' Heq. unfold is_unitary_commutative_ring, integrity, divide in *. destruct H_1 as [H_ring [H_comm H_neutral]]. destruct H_2 as [H_integrity]. apply H_integrity in Heq as H_cases. destruct H_cases as [Ho | Ha_eq_O]. - contradiction. - destruct Ha' as [q [Haq Hmult_eq]]. assert (Mult a (Opp q) = O) as Hmult_opq. + rewrite Hmult_eq. rewrite mult_opp_r with (x:=q) (y:=a); auto. + apply H_integrity in Hmult_opq as [Ho' | Haq_op]. * rewrite mult_O in Ho'; auto. * rewrite mult_opp_l in Haq_op; auto. rewrite Ho' in Haq_op. contradiction.
